page.title: 18A DEVON GREEN LANE.
page.content: A{green lane}is a routeway without a tarmac surface,bounded on either side by hedges.There are 2,000 miles of {green lanes}in{Devon,}but many are neglected or ruined because of progress,e.g.crop spraying,severe cutting back of hedges and new roads. The result is that much of the wild life has been destroyed.On 21st May 1985 our school,Highweek C.P.,chose a lane in square 83E72N,near Mead Farm. {Road Surface.}The road was made of earth and recently stones had been added.It measured about 6 metres across with a passing point half way of 8 metres.There was evidence of drainage.It has a well worn,pitted surface with grass growing in the middle.{The Hedge.}The hedges were 2 metres in width and 2.5 metres in height.In a measured 30 metres of hedge we found 7 different types of
